remarks: Lemma for ~ acexmid .  This builds on ~ acexmidlem1 by noting that every element of ` C ` is inhabited. (Note that ` y ` is not quite a function in the ~ df-fun sense because it uses ordered pairs as described in ~ opthreg rather than ~ df-op ). The set ` A ` is also found in ~ onsucelsucexmidlem . (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 5-Aug-2019.)
statement:
acexmidlem.a $e |- A = { x e. { (/) , { (/) } } | ( x = (/) \/ ph ) } $.
acexmidlem.b $e |- B = { x e. { (/) , { (/) } } | ( x = { (/) } \/ ph ) } $.
acexmidlem.c $e |- C = { A , B } $.
acexmidlem2 $p |- ( A. z e. C A. w e. z E! v e. z E. u e. y ( z e. u /\ v e. u ) -> ( ph \/ -. ph ) ) $.
$d A u v w x y z $.
$d B u v w x y z $.
$d C u v w x y z $.
$d ph u v w x y z $.
